head.title: Online, the Heart Doesn't Need to Be A Lonely Pumper

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Technology, Telecommunications and Internet

hedline.hl1: Online, the Heart Doesn't Need to Be A Lonely Pumper

abstract.p: February is Heart Month and the Howard Hughes Medical Institute, Maryland, offers an animated heart at www.biointeractive.org; site also explains procedures and medical factors related to heart; photo (S)

block.p: One can look into the heart for love or truth, but there are also veins, valves, arteries and blood to be seen. February is Heart Month, and the Howard Hughes Medical Institute in Maryland offers an animated heart at www.biointeractive .org, with pumping muscle, opening and closing valves, and blood flowing from chamber to chamber.
The site also includes explanations of electrocardiograms and blood pressure, plus an image that can be rotated to see the heart from different views.
Browser A selection of events and sites on the Web.
Sites
www.earthcam.com/top25 Links to many Web cams, including the Kremlin, NASA, an insect zoo and the White Mana Diner in Jersey City.
www.avalanche.org Avalanche conditions in places like Mount Shasta, Calif.; Sun Valley, Idaho; and Glacier National Park in Montana, with links to Europe and snow and weather forecast pages.
www.birdsource.org Results are in for the Great Backyard Bird Count for 2000 as of yesterday: sightings of 418 species and more than four million birds.
Events TODAY, 9 p.m.
ArtShapes.com Chat with Aidan Quinn, the actor and producer, and on Tuesday at 9 p.m., the author Frank McCourt.
SUNDAY, 8 p.m.
www.msnbc.com Tom Brokaw will moderate a discussion on the impact of technology, from Silicon Valley.
SUNDAY, 10 p.m.
www.sho.com Live chat with Dr. Maya Angelou, the director of the film ''Down in the Delta,'' after its television premiere on Showtime.
